tips.content: Keep beds away from cold windows and drafts. **Insulation is key.**
Antifreeze is deadly. Clean up all spills immediately and use **pet-safe products**.
Supervise pets near fireplaces and space heaters to prevent **burns and fires**.
Provide an **elevated, straw-filled shelter** to keep them dry and warm.
Limit time outside. **Shorten walks** during extreme cold to prevent hypothermia.
Salt and ice burn! Apply **balm or use boots**. Wipe paws thoroughly after every walk.
Before starting the car, **knock on the hood** to scare away sheltering cats.
Keep pets leashed. Snow and ice can disrupt scents, leading to a **higher risk of getting lost**.
Check water bowls frequently to prevent freezing. **Hydration is crucial** in winter.
Outdoor pets may need more calories. **Consult your vet** for indoor pet diet changes.
Watch for shivering or lethargy (hypothermia). Look for pale skin on **ears and paws**.
Don't over-trim thick coats; their fur provides **natural insulation** from the cold.
